data.title: How to use Ai files in Gimp?
data.text:
.ai files are Adobe Illustrator.

There is one very significant difference between Gimp and Illustrator that you have to understand - they are two completely different programs.

Gimp is used for editing bit-mapped (pixel by pixel) graphics whereas Illustrator is for vector (object-oriented, resolution independent).

In order to edit in Gimp something that has earlier been drawn in Illustrator, you will have to export the file first, so that it is bit-mapped.

To do that, in Illustrator, go to 'File -> Export' and change the filetype to a bit-mapped graphic (BMP, JPEG, PNG).

Then you will be able to open this file with Gimp.

I hope I helped

You can't.

.ai files are Adobe Illustrator files.

However if you open the .ai in Adobe Illustrator and save it as a .eps instead, then you can open that in GIMP. But GIMP will rasterise the image.

GIMP is a raster image editor. Adobe Illustrator is a vector image editor - the two are completely different types of image editing applications.

If you want a free vector image than can open .ai files, then you can get Inkscape here: http://www.inkscape.org
